intro: Erigeron lanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils. It features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Erigeron lanceolatus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
